others, try calling them to see, with the exception of EXPEDIAIMAGING. Do not call EXPEDIAIMAGING I  They have been banned from performing 
services for our office. I just couldn't delete them from the list.

From: 
Sent: Tuesday, September 1, 2020 11:21 AM 
To: =M*; 
Cc: 
Subject RE: Copy/Scan Vendors 
I do not know what the NOC is. 
EFTA00028670

I think they were just asking for recommendations for reputable vendors that we have used in the past. If there are two or three that we have had 
good experiences using, in Fort Lauderdale, Miami, or wherever, I can forward that contact information and leave the rest to them to sort out. Does 
that make sense? 
Thanks for looking into this. 
From: 
Sent: Tuesday, September 1, 2020 11:18 AM 
To: 
Cc: 
).; 
Subject: RE: Copy/Scan Vendors 
Currently, we do not have a contract in place for large/voluminous jobs. We use our Simplified Purchase Agreement (SPA) vendors for any job that 
can't be handled in-house. Normally, these SPA vendors don't have storage space in their facilities to hold discovery past a brief period, and the 
copy/scan jobs are small to medium. There are no restrictions for folks outside of our district on who they can use. If the request is being paid by 
another district, they are free to go wherever they like. To help with the process, I can try to find a few SPA vendors in the WPB area. Then SONY can 
call them to ask if they can handle the job; about their security (confidentiality) protocol; and pricing information. 
Another option may be to send the documents to the NOC. I don't know a lot about the process but we've used it in the past, and it's secure. If 
interested in this option, I can discuss with our in-house Graphics Dept. 
Questions: 
Is there a deadline of when the documents are to be scanned/copied? 
Are the original or copied documents going to opposing counsel to review? 
Will the vendor be required to store the documents to allow defense to view/copy? 
From: 
Sent: Tuesday, September 1, 2020 10:36 AM 
To: 
Cc: 
).; 
Subject: Copy/Scan Vendors 
> 
Good 
Morning 
I hope all is 
well. 
The USAO â€” SDNY is requesting a list of vendors that we've used (I don't believe we have a current contract) for copying and scanning voluminous 
files/documents/cd's and cassette tapes relating to the Jeffrey Epstein case. Obviously, confidentiality and sensitivity are major concerns. 
I believe that SDNY will make the arrangements and pay for the services, but they are requesting a list of vendors that SDFL has used for these types 
of services. Since we do not have a current contract, is there policy that needs to be followed to use a company in this field? 
If memory serves me, I don't believe any of the companies were local to West Palm Beach (where the documents are being stored). I believe the 
companies were in the Fort Lauderdale and Miami area. 
Any information, assistance and guidance you can provide would be greatly appreciated. 
Thank you and take care, 
Office Manager, WPB 
EFTA00028671
